bow: what songs do you sing to your little one to get him or her to sleep need some new ideas lately midnight special works ~~every time~~ once in while oh and rex blues sing edelweiss because my dad used to sing it to us when we were little edit and once upon december from anastasia hum baby of mine the little one loves to watch feed the birds from mary poppins and pure imagination from willy wonka while laying in bed bette midler does great cover of baby of mine sing the lion sleeps tonight it been our bedtime song since he was born granted my son name is leo but ve grown to love it as sleep song because it repetitive can change up the first half to whatever want and it simple my song of choice has always been three little birds simple repetitive and soothing for both me and the little ones just added that one to my mix last night dream little dream of me usually do you are my sunshine twinkle twinkle little star and baby beluga if tired of baby songs ll just sing soothing song like like white winter hymnal did leave nobody but the baby or the way am and so it goes billy joel just love this song and it is so pretty my oldest daughter middle name is sunshine so we always did you are my sunshine also sing baby mine usually elizabeth mitchell who my pretty baby or zousan just the english lyrics bc do want to mess it up too badly haha sometimes throw in ben harper forever he 16 months now and these songs still calm him down anything bob marley works too sing 99 bottles of beer but singing is generally last resort so it helps me stay engaged while knowing that he will likely conk out by 65 bottles ll be collecting my mom of the year award any day now dream is wish your heart makes from cinderella once upon dream from sleeping beauty you are my sunshine tomorrow from annie when you wish upon star from pinnochio those are the main ones but have few others on rotation strange selection but usually end up singing rocket man by elton john sometimes just recite everything we did that day to any melody that pops into my head that serves as nice reflection gratitude time for me too glad for this thread got few ideas for new songs if my baby is sick of hearing about raising kids on mars twinkle twinkle little star the alphabet somewhere over the rainbow silent night amazing grace frere jacque rockabye baby mary had little lamb and made up songs to the tune of happy birthday sing lot more but these are the calmest ones sing this land is your land and lots of beatles songs my toddlers love puff the magic dragon and request it every night twinkle twinkle little star hush little baby amp this pretty planet do his lullabye he does some good songs to hum them to sleep my son does sleep but his latest songs of choice are wagon wheel and the saga begins we re an odd bunch but he loves us my littles love hey jude and hallelujah we have the first two are dixie chicks songs one called lullabye and the other one called godspeed sweet dreams and have boys so often sing this song by wade bowen called before these walls were blue sing that one edelweiss to my little girl ever since her first day and she is and half now you are my sunshine and twinkle twinkle have been our staple from to work really well my daughter gets any of these dream is wish your heart makes from cinderella close to you by the carpenters temple of time from legend of zelda ocarina of time you are my sunshine gille beag little boy colour my world by chicago do know why but my daughter has always loved the temple of time song it used to lull her to sleep with white noise when she was newborn it always make me kinda sad to sing it though just another reminder that one more day gone and she ll never be quite this small again time passes so fast my go to has been down to the river to pray because you can loop it endlessly and it not too exciting in earlier days we also did the lion sleeps tonight he ll calm down nicely with the hawaiian war chant so long as skip the bridge for some reason it makes him really angry and lately started singing still alive my husband uses the inchworm song lot bushel and peck you are my sunshine and billy joel good night angel love ending with good night angel because one of the lines some day your child may cry and if you sing this lullaby then in your heart there will always be part of me my mom sang bushel and peck to me and you are my sunshine has been the family lullaby for at least generations do you realize by the flaming lips deleted there spanish song my mother used to sing me that sang to my daughter and will sing to my son when he born have no clue what saying usually lol would love to sing that song to my baby but sure just start crying my mom sang me bushel and peck too lt not quite mama yet more weeks but think dream little dream of me would be lovely one and once when my niece was crying and was out of ideas for songs sang her look at me sandra dee forever young it been their song for seven years now ❤️ we do wonderwall by oasis and yellow submarine but the caspar babypants version at least when they are stuck in my head they are not too annoying great green gobs of greasy grimy gopher guts and read to him my son is six and still sing it to him cried by he first time sang it in high school but after that was fine switch to humming when he is almost asleep always be my baby mariah carey not quite lullaby but hey know all the words silent night is magic baby song grew up watching my mom sing it to every baby she ever tried to get to sleep my lo also likes hush little baby to make you feel my love but not very well you are my sunshine and my take on little ponys hush by do you cry go to sleep my little one when you awaken we shall play but that different day pinks and blues yellows and reds all the pretty little flowers seal lullaby by rudyard kipling my dad sang it to me and my siblings sing your song by elton john it nice soft tune and it has nice meaning for when they start understanding more of what you re saying also sing satisfied mind by porter wagoner something about it just puts my kids to sleep probably because their pop pop used to sing it to them sweet baby james always calms my little man and his name is james also do all my loving by the beatles which he loves as well used to sing it to my niece when she was babe so still associate it with rocking an lo to sleep usually sing or hum rainbow connection from the muppet movie and if that not long enough go twinkle twinkle little star and then row row row your boat on infinite loop hush little baby danny song by loggins and messina it does make him sleepy but it calms him down during melt downs sing mamma wing by karla adolphe to my month old daughter she out like light before even finish anything soft usually does the trick usually once day my so busts out his acoustic and we both sing to her she loves it that was our father daughter dance at my wedding remember being about years old and it being on commercial and my dad telling me it would be the song we would dance to at my wedding we never talked about it again but he teared up when it came on also walked down the aisle to guns and roses his fav band song sweet child of mine instrumental little ghost by the white stripes we ve always called our daughter little ghost and when heard that song it had to become one of her lullabies this is the song my mother sang to me and sing now to the baby love it used to sing buried bone by blind pilot https www youtube com watch v=3afdvr1 isg but now he mostly goes down on his own his mobile plays hush little baby but do sing along you ve lost that loving feeling somewhere over the rainbow do know why it was the first song that came to mind when started singing to her my hubby and sing rainbow connection as part of the bedtime routine rainbow connection is our bedtime song only song that works right now is the kookaburra song ve always sung wagon wheel by bob dylan and boats and birds by gregory and the hawk me too for the longest time we sang bob schneider honeypot and let the light in bob schneider is much beloved austin singer songwriter lately we ve switched it up and are singing tulalulalura and my little buttercup yes from the three amigos we also love most anything by lucy wainwright roche made up lullaby for each of my kids my son now requests his at three my daughter is months and still fine tuning hers do both the bob dylan version and the rod stewart version have been singing growing up from the second care bears movie from when was kid lol oh man did think there was another one out there who sang once upon december live anastasia so much journey to the past is good too like to sing songs like and know the words to imagine by lennon travelling soldier by dixie chicks from this moment on by teain and my personal favourite love me tender by elvis only one song has lasted seven years and still works little boxes yep song about 1950s post war suburban keeping up with the joneses puts my son out like light every night it has kimd of good message it fun to sing he loves it and have sung it about million times over in every style imaginable the runner up which worked for years was the twelve days of christmas lot of the ones we do were already mentioned but ll add two more favorites the circle song by joni mitchell which my mom used to also sing to me and save for special occasions since it takes longer than our normal routine and john lennon beautiful boy yeeeeeees moon river has always been our go to seems to be very calming really love the kroc version with beck and the lips backing him soft kitty my girl tons of sublime anything know the words to oh yeah hallelujah is staple have it on the driving home late let all go to sleep playlist sing little wing into little birds since was pregnant lt there spanish song by josh groban that my daughter likes so usually sing that or one of the italian ones of his do know what any of them mean but they sound like love songs so sing them here comes the sun https www youtube com watch v=xobmjaeovpa is good one because it slowish and it easy to sing it really quietly usually will sing whichever beatles song have stuck in my head these last few days it was dear prudence too rah loo rah we sing it every night before bed 10 months and if he is really fussy at nap time you are my sunshine mama what train goin away by utah phillips amazing grace battle hymn of the republic star spangled banner ants go marching hum temple of time and eponas song sometimes they are just so mellow and easy sing the boat song by jj heller my baby is six weeks old and ve yet to get through this song without weeping one day sleep baby sleep pretty little horses brahms lullaby the riddle song and swing low there are few more if it takes them while to fall asleep but those are my go tos this version of la claire fontaine https www youtube com watch v=0a2l6bgaeoa and **somewhere over the rainbow** they work wonders these arms of mine otis redding it started with my oldest when she was in the nicu also hey jude somehow was tired and desperate one night and busted out with joseph and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat it stuck thought my almost year old had forgotten about it until she requested the crash of light song week ago sing both of those too my older daughter is anytime she is sick she still asks for baby mine my husband sings american pie to our girls it drives him crazy when start inserting the saga begins verses keep doing it though just wish that would be the only exposure they would have to episode me and bobby mcghee sweet child of mine little birds sitting on the dock of the bay into the mystic twinkle twinkle little star those are the main ones really bobby mcghee is her choice 10 of the time ve read some other good ones in this thread that going to add into the mix thanks for that sing what thought were the lyrics to brahms lullaby when was kid she tries to hum it to me when not singing and wants me to so cute my son is leo too cute idea for the little lion man whoa came here to say once upon december ve been singing it
